2745.26.text:
[Question] I was wondering one
of the things I saw the very beginning

2755.02.text:
when you were talking about feedback is

2766.75.text:

2774.27.text:

How did you deflate them?

2779.76.text:
You can deal with it in two ways,
firstly take it on the chin, look at the internet, look at

2789.70.text:
the amount of negative posts you get on
the internet versus the positive posts

2794.44.text:
but in a company when people talk about
negative things its usually operational you're

2800.46.text:

2803.42.text: it's the functional spec, it should do all of these things

2810.91.text:
in the sense of designed thinking is set up for
good start ups and you want to

2815.92.text:

something that's an enterprise tool for

2821.50.text:
70,000 people you actually want things
that are great for 70-60,000 people

2827.49.text:
having things that do everything for
everyone isn't what you want and so

2832.97.text:
sometimes you have to be a little bit
strong

2836.28.text:
to say these are things we can have that are core
and if you do want something that's very

2840.45.text:
specific, then they'll have to 
pay for that separately.
